text: Let G be a group and let N be a normal subgroup of G. Then G/N=\\{gN:g\in{G}\\} is the set of all cosets of N in G and is called the quotient group of N in G. This group is used in the proof of Lagrange's Theorem, for instance. In fact, the proof of Lagrange's theorem establishes that if G is finite, then |G/H|=|G|/|H|. ==References== Category:Group theory
title: Quotient group
